author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
@giordano can you spot what needs to be done in order to get this merged? I'm out of ideas :/ Thank you :) [noblock]
All the comments without `[noblock]` (including yours) are blocking registration
Also, note that users should _**not**_ try to trigger the registration bot here but only in the repository.

Thanks for fixing! I think there might have been some problem initiated by the call to `@JuliaRegistrator` being triggered by `@martinamaggio` rather than by the repo owner `@NilsVreman`, can this be correct? The bot seems to have complained about that? Nils initially had some comment without [noblock] that was edited to include it but it made no difference, so I guess there was still something (including later my post), that held it back.
Error while trying to register: Action not recognized: being
